display.label: QuickBooks
display.description: Create and manage customers and invoices within Intuit QuickBooks

connections.label: QuickBooks OAuth 2.0
connections.comments: Authenticate requests to QuickBooks using values obtained from the Developer Console.

inputs.comments: The OAuth 2.0 Authorization URL for QuickBooks
inputs.label: Authorize URL

inputs.comments: The OAuth 2.0 Token URL for QuickBooks
inputs.label: Token URL

inputs.comments: The OAuth 2.0 Revocation URL for QuickBooks
inputs.label: Revoke URL

inputs.comments: A space-delimited set of one or more scopes to get the user's permission to access.
inputs.label: Scopes

inputs.comments: Choose whether or not to use QuickBooks' sandbox. This is helpful for integration testing.
inputs.label: Use Sandbox

documentation.description:
QuickBooks uses OAuth 2.0 to authenticate requests against the QuickBooks Online API.
To configure an OAuth 2.0 credential through QuickBooks, you will need to [create an app](https://www.developer.intuit.com/app/developer/qbo/docs/develop/authentication-and-authorization/oauth-2.0-playground#get-the-access-token) within the Intuit developer portal.
When you create your app, be sure to enter Prismatic's OAuth callback URL - https<!---->://oauth2.prismatic.io/callback - as a **Callback URL**.
Consult QuickBooks to determine the proper OAuth Scopes to assign.
Once the app has been created, you will be provided with a **Client ID** and **Client Secret**.
Now, configure OAuth 2.0 settings in Prismatic.
Create a new credential of type **OAuth 2.0 - Authorization Code**.

-   Enter the **Client ID** and **Client Secret** that you received from the Intuit developer portal.
-   Set **Scopes** to any of the values in [this list.](https://developer.intuit.com/app/developer/qbo/docs/learn/scopes)

display.label: Get Company Info
display.description: Retrieve information about the company

display.label: Get Resource
display.description: Retrieve a QuickBooks resource using their SQL-like data query language

inputs.comments: Must be a valid query string as defined by the QuickBooks API. Single quotes must be escaped with a backslash.
inputs.label: Query String

inputs.comments: Provide the version of the API you would like to use.
inputs.label: API Minor Version

documentation.description: This action allows for sending queries to [the Query endpoint](https://developer.intuit.com/app/developer/qbo/docs/learn/explore-the-quickbooks-online-api/data-queries#use-query-operation). Please [refer to QuickBooks' documentation](https://developer.intuit.com/app/developer/qbo/docs/learn/explore-the-quickbooks-online-api/data-queries#query-syntax) for building custom queries.

display.label: Get Vendor Expenses
display.description: Retrieve information about vendor expenses

inputs.comments: Customize the information returned in the report by specifying query parameters with the query. Listed here are the query parameters available for this report: customer, vendor, end_date, date_macro, class, sort_order, summarize_column_id, department, accounting_method, and start_date
inputs.label: Query Params

documentation.description:
This action wraps QuickBooks' [Query a Report](https://developer.intuit.com/app/developer/qbo/docs/api/accounting/report-entities/vendorexpenses#query-a-report) API endpoint.
Query parameters can be added to filter results by `customer`, `vendor`, `department`, `accounting_method`, or `class`.
Keys `summarize_column_by` and `sort_order` determine how the result should be structured.
You can also specify a `date_macro`, or a combination of a `start_date` and `end_date` (both need to be specified) to get expenses from a particular date range.

<Screenshot
  filename="components/quickbooks/query-vendor-expenses-parameters.png"
  maxWidth="600px"
/>

display.label: Raw Request
display.description: Send a raw HTTP request to QuickBooks API

inputs.comments: Input the path only (/v3/company/1234567890/invoice), The base URL is already included (https://quickbooks.api.intuit.com for production or https://sandbox-quickbooks.api.intuit.com for sandbox). For example, to connect to https://quickbooks.api.intuit.com/v3/company/1234567890/invoice, only /v3/company/1234567890/invoice is entered in this field.
inputs.label: URL

inputs.comments: The HTTP method to use.
inputs.label: Method

inputs.comments: The HTTP body payload to send to the URL.
inputs.label: Data

inputs.comments: The Form Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: Form Data

inputs.comments: File Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: File Data

inputs.comments: A list of query parameters to send with the request. This is the portion at the end of the URL similar to ?key1=value1&key2=value2.
inputs.label: Query Parameter

inputs.comments: A list of headers to send with the request.
inputs.label: Header

inputs.comments: The type of data you expect in the response. You can request json, text, or binary data.
inputs.label: Response Type

inputs.comments: The maximum time that a client will await a response to its request
inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: Enabling this flag will log out the current request.
inputs.label: Debug Request

inputs.comments: The delay in milliseconds between retries.
inputs.label: Retry Delay (ms)

inputs.comments: If true, retries on all erroneous responses regardless of type.
inputs.label: Retry On All Errors

inputs.comments: The maximum number of retries to attempt.
inputs.label: Max Retry Count

inputs.comments: Specifies whether to use a pre-defined exponential backoff strategy for retries.
inputs.label: Use Exponential Backoff

documentation.description:
[QuickBooks](https://quickbooks.intuit.com/) is an accounting and payment platform for individuals and businesses.
This component allows you to generate invoices, manage customers, and more within the QuickBooks platform.
documentation.dev:
The [QuickBooks Sandbox](https://www.developer.intuit.com/app/developer/sandbox) allows developers to develop and test integrations without affecting real customer data.
You can point your integrations at this sandbox as you assemble them.
